definitions: group of items gathered together for display, study, or preservation
process of obtaining payment of overdue debts from individuals or organizations
designer's seasonal set of new clothing designs for retail
examples: The museum's collection includes rare ancient Egyptian artifacts
She donated her stamp collection to the local philatelic society
The bank hired an agency for collection of outstanding loans
Collection notices were sent to all overdue account holders
The designer's autumn collection featured bold colors and textures
Fashion editors previewed the spring collection at Paris Fashion Week

definitions: organization or business owned and controlled jointly by its members
relating to or done by people acting together as a group
examples: The artists formed a collective to share studio space
The farming collective pooled resources to purchase equipment
Collective action achieved better working conditions for all employees
The collective decision reflected everyone's input and concerns

definitions: political or economic theory advocating collective control especially over production and distribution
examples: Collectivism emphasizes group goals over individual desires and achievements
The debate between collectivism and individualism shapes many political discussions

definitions: person who collects things of a specified type as hobby or investment
official responsible for collecting taxes or other payments due
electrode or terminal that collects electric charge in electronic devices
examples: The stamp collector spent decades building her comprehensive collection
Art collectors gathered at the auction house for rare pieces
The tax collector visited businesses to ensure compliance with regulations
Revenue collectors processed payments at the government office
The transistor's collector terminal connects to the positive voltage supply
Engineers tested the solar collector's efficiency in converting sunlight

definitions: institution of higher education offering undergraduate degrees and specialized programs
organized group of professional people with particular aims and privileges
examples: She graduated from college with a degree in engineering
The college campus sprawled across three hundred acres
The Royal College of Surgeons maintains professional standards nationwide
The electoral college determines the presidential election outcome

definitions: scientific apparatus that accelerates particles to high speeds and brings them together in collisions for research
examples: The Large Hadron Collider discovered the Higgs boson particle
Scientists proposed building a new collider for advanced physics research

definitions: herding dog breed originating from Scotland with long coat and pointed snout
examples: The border collie herded sheep across the hillside pasture
Their rough collie won best in show at the competition

definitions: instance of moving objects striking forcefully against each other causing damage
serious disagreement or conflict between opposing ideas, interests, or factions
examples: The collision between two cars caused major traffic delays
Scientists study particle collisions to understand fundamental physics
The collision of cultures created tension in the community
Their collision of interests led to lengthy legal proceedings

definitions: academic meeting or seminar where specialists deliver presentations on a topic and discuss them
examples: The physics colloquium featured Nobel laureates discussing quantum mechanics
Graduate students presented research at the department's weekly colloquium

definitions: secret cooperation or conspiracy between parties to deceive others or gain unfair advantage
examples: The companies faced charges of collusion to fix market prices
Evidence of collusion between officials and contractors emerged during investigation

definitions: scented liquid made from alcohol and fragrant oils worn on the body
examples: He applied cologne sparingly before the important business meeting
The department store offered samples of their new cologne collection

definitions: punctuation mark consisting of two dots placed vertically to introduce lists or explanations
main part of the large intestine extending from cecum to rectum
examples: Use a colon before introducing a list of items
The colon separates the title from the subtitle
The doctor examined the colon for signs of inflammation
Colon cancer screening is recommended after age fifty

definitions: senior military officer rank typically commanding a regiment below brigadier general
examples: The colonel addressed troops before their deployment overseas
She was promoted to colonel after twenty years of service

definitions: person living in or relating to a colony during the colonial period
architectural or decorative style characteristic of American colonial period
examples: Colonial settlers established the first permanent European settlements
The colonial governor imposed new taxes on imported goods
They restored the colonial mansion to its eighteenth-century appearance
Colonial furniture features simple lines and practical design

definitions: practice of acquiring control over another country and exploiting it economically while imposing cultural values
examples: Colonialism shaped the modern political boundaries of many African nations
Scholars debate colonialism's lasting effects on developing economies worldwide

definitions: person who supports or practices colonialism and the establishment of colonies
examples: Colonialists justified expansion through claims of bringing civilization to territories
Anti-colonialist movements gained momentum after the Second World War

definitions: action or process of settling and establishing control over indigenous people of an area
spread and establishment of organisms in a new habitat or environment
examples: The colonisation of Australia began in the late eighteenth century
Forced colonisation displaced millions of indigenous peoples worldwide
Bacterial colonisation of wounds can lead to serious infections
Plant colonisation of volcanic islands occurs through wind-dispersed seeds

definitions: person who settles in a colony or new country as part of colonization
examples: Early colonists faced harsh winters and food shortages initially
The colonists declared independence from their mother country

definitions: action or process of settling and establishing control over indigenous people of an area
spread and establishment of organisms in a new habitat or environment
examples: European colonization of the Americas transformed both continents permanently
The colonization process often involved military force and coercion
Fungal colonization of plant roots provides mutual nutritional benefits
Scientists study microbial colonization patterns in hospital environments

definitions: person or nation that establishes colonies in other territories
organism that establishes itself in a new habitat or environment
examples: Spanish colonizers brought new diseases to indigenous populations
Colonizers often imposed their language and religion on territories
These plants are aggressive colonizers of disturbed soil areas
Bacterial colonizers rapidly multiply in favorable environmental conditions

definitions: row of regularly spaced columns supporting a roof structure or upper story
examples: The marble colonnade created an impressive entrance to the museum
Ancient Greek temples featured colonnades surrounding the main structure

definitions: medical examination of the colon using a flexible tube with camera to detect abnormalities
examples: The doctor recommended a colonoscopy to screen for colon cancer
Regular colonoscopy procedures can prevent colorectal cancer through early detection

definitions: country or area under political control of another country and occupied by settlers
group of organisms of same species living together in one place
community of people of one nationality living in a foreign place
examples: The thirteen colonies declared independence from British rule
France established colonies throughout Africa and Southeast Asia
The ant colony worked together to build elaborate underground tunnels
Scientists discovered a colony of rare bats in the cave
The artist colony attracted painters and sculptors from around Europe
An expatriate colony formed in the coastal resort town

definitions: property of objects producing different sensations on the eye through reflected light
pigmentation of skin especially as indication of someone's race or ethnicity
interesting or exciting features that give character or distinction to something
examples: The artist mixed colors to create the perfect sunset shade
Primary colors combine to form all other color variations
People of color fought for civil rights throughout American history
Discrimination based on color violates federal employment laws
Her stories added color to the otherwise mundane historical facts
The festival brought color and excitement to the quiet town

definitions: natural color patterns and markings of an animal or plant
subtle effect or influence that colors perception or interpretation
examples: The butterfly's coloration provides camouflage from predators
Seasonal coloration changes help animals adapt to environments
Political coloration affected how the news story was reported
The author's personal coloration influenced the historical narrative

definitions: process or art of applying color to something
natural color and appearance of someone's skin, hair, and eyes
substance used to give color to food or other materials
examples: Children enjoyed coloring pictures in their activity books
The coloring technique required careful attention to shading
Her fair coloring suggested Northern European ancestry
The baby inherited his father's dark coloring
Food coloring made the frosting bright blue
Natural coloring from vegetables replaced artificial dyes

definitions: hairdresser who specializes in dyeing and coloring hair
artist who specializes in color theory and application in visual media
examples: The colorist recommended highlights to complement her skin tone
She visited her colorist every six weeks for root touch-ups
The comic book colorist brought the illustrations to vivid life
Film colorists adjust scenes to create specific moods

definitions: property of objects producing different sensations on the eye through reflected light
pigmentation of skin especially as indication of someone's race or ethnicity
interesting or exciting features that give character or distinction to something
examples: The garden displayed every colour of the rainbow
She studied colour theory in her art degree program
Discrimination based on colour remains illegal under British law
People of colour comprise the majority in many urban areas
Local traditions add colour to the tourist experience
His personality brought colour to every social gathering

definitions: natural colour patterns and markings of an animal or plant
subtle effect or influence that colours perception or interpretation
examples: The bird's colouration changes during mating season
Desert animals developed colouration matching their sandy environment
Cultural colouration shaped the anthropologist's field observations
The report showed political colouration in its conclusions

definitions: process or art of applying colour to something
natural colour and appearance of someone's skin, hair, and eyes
substance used to give colour to food or other materials
examples: The colouring competition attracted hundreds of young artists
Digital colouring transformed the animation industry completely
Mediterranean colouring suits warm-toned clothing particularly well
The twins had completely different colouring despite being identical
Beetroot provides natural colouring for the cake frosting
Artificial colouring in sweets concerns many parents

definitions: young male horse typically under four years of age
brand name of firearms particularly associated with revolvers and pistols
examples: The colt stayed close to its mother in the pasture
They trained the colt for racing from six months old
The sheriff carried a Colt revolver in the Old West
Colt firearms became synonymous with American frontier history

definitions: upright pillar typically cylindrical supporting a structure or standing alone as monument
vertical division of a page or vertical arrangement of items
regular article or feature appearing in a newspaper or magazine
examples: Marble columns supported the ancient temple's massive roof
The column cracked during the earthquake but remained standing
Numbers arranged in columns make calculations easier to perform
The spreadsheet displayed data in neat columns and rows
She writes a weekly advice column for the newspaper
His political column appears every Sunday morning

definitions: journalist who writes regular articles for a newspaper or magazine
examples: The political columnist won a Pulitzer Prize for commentary
Fashion columnists attended all the major runway shows worldwide

definitions: state of deep unconsciousness from which a person cannot be awakened
optical aberration causing blurred images especially at the edge of lenses
examples: The patient remained in a coma for three weeks following the accident
Doctors monitored brain activity while she was in the coma
The telescope's coma distorted stars at the field edges
Lens designers work to minimize coma in optical systems

definitions: toothed implement for arranging and cleaning hair
structure of hexagonal wax cells built by bees for storing honey
fleshy crest on the head of domestic fowl especially roosters
examples: She ran the comb through her tangled hair carefully
The antique silver comb belonged to her grandmother
Bees filled every comb with golden honey
The honeycomb structure provides maximum storage with minimum material
The rooster's bright red comb stood prominently upright
A healthy comb indicates good health in chickens

definitions: fighting between armed forces in war or battle
vigorous action taken to overcome or eliminate something harmful
examples: Soldiers trained for combat in urban environments
The unit saw heavy combat during the military campaign
New measures will combat rising crime rates effectively
Scientists combat disease through vaccine development programs

definitions: person or nation engaged in fighting during a war or conflict
examples: Enemy combatants were detained according to international law
Both combatants sustained injuries during the fierce battle

definitions: long curling wave of the sea that has reached its peak before breaking
person or machine that combs and prepares fibers for spinning
examples: Surfers waited for the perfect comber to ride
Large combers crashed against the rocky shoreline
The comber separated short fibers from the long ones
Industrial combers process thousands of pounds of wool daily

definitions: joining or merging of different parts or qualities to form a whole
sequence of numbers or letters used to open a lock
examples: The combination of flavors created an extraordinary dining experience
This drug combination proved highly effective against the disease
She forgot the combination to her school locker
The safe's combination was known only to management

definitions: large farming machine that cuts, threshes, and cleans grain crops
group of people or organizations acting together for commercial or political purpose
examples: The combine harvested wheat across the vast prairie fields
Farmers invested in a new combine for the harvest season
The industrial combine controlled most of the market share
Several companies formed a combine to negotiate better terms

definitions: action of arranging or cleaning hair with a comb
systematic and thorough searching of an area or information
examples: Daily combing prevents tangles in long hair
Gentle combing distributed natural oils through her hair
Police began combing the woods for evidence
Researchers spent months combing through historical archives

definitions: action or process of joining or merging two or more things together
examples: Combining different teaching methods improves student learning outcomes
The chef excelled at combining unusual ingredients creatively

definitions: combination of different things offered or purchased together, especially food items
small musical group, especially playing jazz or popular music
examples: The lunch combo includes a sandwich, drink, and fries
She ordered the combo meal to save money
The jazz combo performed at the downtown club
A five-piece combo provided dance music for the reception

definitions: substance or material that can catch fire and burn easily
examples: Store combustible materials away from heat sources
The warehouse contained highly combustible chemicals requiring special handling

definitions: rapid chemical process producing heat and light through reaction with oxygen
examples: Internal combustion engines power most automobiles worldwide
Complete combustion of fuel produces carbon dioxide and water

definitions: return to prominence or popularity after a period of decline or obscurity
quick reply to a critical remark or challenging statement
examples: The singer staged a remarkable comeback after years away
The team's comeback victory thrilled fans nationwide
She always had a clever comeback for his teasing remarks
His comeback silenced the critics immediately

definitions: professional entertainer who performs comedy by making people laugh through jokes and amusing situations
examples: The comedian performed stand-up routines at comedy clubs nationwide
Famous comedians often start their careers in small venues

definitions: female professional entertainer who performs comedy by making people laugh
examples: The comedienne headlined shows at major theaters across the country
Pioneer comediennes paved the way for today's female comics

definitions: professional entertainment consisting of jokes and sketches intended to make audiences laugh
amusing or humorous aspect of something
examples: The comedy show featured both established and emerging performers
Shakespeare wrote comedies as well as tragedies
The comedy of errors led to everyone arriving at wrong locations
Life's little comedies make everyday experiences more bearable

definitions: person who arrives or comes to a place
person likely to be successful in the future
examples: The first comer gets the best seat
Late comers will not be admitted during the performance
She's an up-and-comer in the technology industry
Young comers in politics bring fresh perspectives
